title: [$25] Add context comment to help with auto-translating "Outstanding" report status

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Problem

In New Expensify, submitted reports have the status `Outstanding`. This word has multiple meanings in English, and our AI auto-translation into other languages doesn't always translate based on the correct definition. Examples:

- Portuguese: `Excelente` (incorrect)
- French: `Exceptionnel` (incorrect)
- Spanish: `Pendiente` (correct)

## Solution

We can add a context annotation in the /App/blob/main/src/languages/en.ts file. The annotation should say:

```
// @context meaning "remaining to be paid, done, or dealt with", not "exceptionally good"
outstanding: 'Outstanding',
```

Then, retranslate that either with:

`npx ts-node ./scripts/generateTranslations.ts --paths 'common.outstanding'`

or commit the change and open a PR, or you can run it locally with:

`npx ts-node ./scripts/generateTranslations.ts --compare-ref main`

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @brunovjk</details>

If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Issue reported by:** @zsgreenwald **Slack conversation:** [#convert](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1758760068295019) ## Action Performed: 1. Add a direct card feed in New Expensify (not via Plaid). 2. Get to the statement close date step. 3. Select a date. 4. Tap Apply. ## Expected Result: We close the RHP add card feed flow, showing only the card feed in the main pane (this is what we already do for Plaid feeds). ## Actual Result: We keep the RHP open and show the card feed settings page, which is different from how we handle Plaid feeds. ## Workaround: The user can manually close the RHP, but it's confusing, as it seems like the settings page is the next step in the flow, when it really isn't. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos #### How this works with direct feeds now https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6061e9f1-04d4-4761-94de-1bd1d2b63957 #### How it works with Plaid (how we want it to work) https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5268b71-63f5-43e3-b7a9-0b706ea3f816 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.20-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71474 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** smddsjoidsjonjsdo@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: BUG 1: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create a distance expense on Map tab. 4. Create a distance expense on Manual tab. 5. Delete the workspace. 6. Open the expense report. 7. Open the distance expense created via Map tab (Step 3). 8. Click Distance, edit distance and save it. â†’ The error message is "Unexpected error editing this expense. Please try again later." 9. Open the distance expense created via Manual tab (Step 4). 10. Click Distance, edit distance and save it. â†’ The error message is "The workspace is no longer accessible. Please try again on a different workspace." BUG 2: Precondition: - Have at least two distance rates - Rate A and B. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create a distance expense on Map tab using Rate B. 4. Create a distance expense on Manual tab using Rate B 5. Go to workspace settings > Distance rates. 6. Delete Rate B. 7. Open the distance expense created via Map tab (Step 3). 8. Click Distance, edit distance and save it. â†’ The error message is "Unexpected error editing this expense. Please try again later." 9. Open the distance expense created via Manual tab (Step 4). 10. Click Distance, edit distance and save it. â†’ The error message is "The selected rate has been deleted." ## Expected Result: BUG 1 & BUG 2: The error message should be the same as when editing distance expense created via Map tab and Manual tab when workspace is deleted/rate is not valid. ## Actual Result: BUG 1: Step 8 - When Map distance is edited on archived workspace, the error message is "Unexpected error editing this expense. Please try again later." Step 10 - When Manual distance is edited on archived workspace, the error message is "The workspace is no longer accessible. Please try again on a different workspace." BUG 2: When rate is not valid, Step 8 - When Map distance is edited, the error message is "Unexpected error editing this expense. Please try again later." Step 10 - When Manual distance is edited, the error message is "The selected rate has been deleted." ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/475da524-e12f-4769-ace4-cc693590fb14 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/438bbf54-a84e-4a9f-b2d9-de8771974f01 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.20-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1027/folder/13176744/41237145/924220246 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1863@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace available. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Track a manual distance expense. 4. Open the report of the just created expense. 5. Tap on the amount field and edit the amount. 6. Note that an "Amount differs from calulated distance" error message appears on "Amount" field. 7. Return to chat. 8. Note that the error message is not visible on expense preview. 9. Navigate to "Reports" 10. Expand the preview of the report where the expense was created. 11. Note that the error message appears on preview. 12. Return to chat. 13. Note that error message is still not displayed on expense preview. ## Expected Result: Error message displayed on expense report after editing amount, should be also visible on the preview of the expense. ## Actual Result: Error message displayed on expense report after editing amount on a manual distance expense, can be seen on preview of the expense on "Reports", but is not visible on expense preview on chat. Also, no RBR is displayed on chat preview on LHN. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8788b12e-1722-4437-8a99-de5252e6bc00 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
